explains: v. 计算；认为；指望（reckon 的 ing 形式）
wordGroup: day of reckoning n. 结账日；最后审判日
dead reckoning n. 航位推测法

sentences.en: The mechanical clock kept equal hours, and this implied a new time reckoning.
sentences.cn: 机械钟的时间是一样的，这就意味着要进行新的时间计算。

sentences.en: By my reckoning we were seven or eight miles from the campground.
sentences.cn: 据我估算我们离露营地大约七八英里远。

sentences.en: Officials concerned with environmental policy predict that a day of reckoning will come.
sentences.cn: 担心环境政策的官员们预言总有一天人们会受到报应。
